channel.title: Calling All Developers Who Know Shell...I truly need help Rep++
channel.description:
EDIT: I KNOW HOW TO JAR MY CLIENT. I NEED TO KNOW HOW TO SIGN IT ON A MAC NOW.
Hello,
I have my client all ready for being jared and put online as a web client. My problem is, I can't find out how to jar my client correctly :/ The tuts for RSPS clients are designed for Windows, and the other tuts aren't designed for the file jaring of my client. Does anyone know the shell commands to properly jar a RSPS client? Also, do I need to sign my jar file? If so, how would I do that correctly on a Unix-based OS (shell commands?)?
TheCyberMan
P.S. I have a Mac, and I'm darn proud of it–especially with how far I've gotten translating code designed for PCs...

item.title: Calling All Developers Who Know Shell...I truly need help Rep++
item.dc:creator: @TheCyberMan TheCyberMan
item.description:
@TheCyberMan wrote:

I don’t know how to use netbeans, and I can’t find anything on Google. It can be done with shell; I just don’t know the exact commands for RSPS.

Read full topic

TheCyberMan:

Guys, I haven’t gotten anywhere with this >.< Does everybody not know how to use shell for this? I’ve spent hours doing guess and test (followed by research of course).

NetBeans, mate.
I doubt you can use shell.

item.title: Calling All Developers Who Know Shell...I truly need help Rep++
item.dc:creator: @killer117 killer117
item.description:
@killer117 wrote:

[quote=“TheCyberMan, post:7, topic:406993”][quote author=killer117 link=topic=503972.msg3687933#msg3687933 date=1311956468]
Download JARMaker: http://www.goldenstudios.or.id/products/utilities/jarmaker/JARMaker.zip
It’s a .jar file, so all you have to do is double-click it if you’re on a mac.

Ric made an awesome tutorial on how to jar it in his tutorial Here

I made my whole webclient on a mac, and there’s nothing windows-specific to it.
[/quote]
Yes, but at one point, you have to use a .exe file that the macs don’t have.[/quote]
What file would that be?

Read full topic

item.title: Calling All Developers Who Know Shell...I truly need help Rep++
item.dc:creator: @dain_bramage dain bramage
item.description:
@dain_bramage wrote:

If you're using Java, you don't need to translate any code, as if it works for PC, it should work the same for Mac.

[url=http://www.netbeans.org/]Netbeans[/url] lets you jar automatically and works for all platforms (including Mac). Other than that, the only other way would be finding another IDE that jars (Eclipse?), or finding a jar maker made in java (I think the link above's one is in java?).

GL.

If you’re using Java, you don’t need to translate any code, as if it works for PC, it should work the same for Mac.

Netbeans lets you jar automatically and works for all platforms (including Mac). Other than that, the only other way would be finding another IDE that jars (Eclipse?), or finding a jar maker made in java (I think the link above’s one is in java?).

GL.

Read full topic

item.description:
@TheCyberMan wrote:

iiii jake iiii:

Click Here This will tell you how to jar your client for correctly hope it helps, also this works on anything as far as im concerned

Really dude? I appreciate your answering, but could I not make it obvious enough that I’m on a Unix OS needing shell commands? It’s written all over my post…you just gave me another youtube video designed for PCs…

TheCyberMan
